title: @Riot Repertoir, Control Mages
body:
Do you think the recent changes to mages itemization was enough for more control mages to be taken in the lcs and other pro leagues? 
if not are there any plans to help them more? I was thinking of auto attack buffs as I mentioned in this post: http://boards.euw.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/suggestions-bug-reports-en/cEZ9EgXO-control-mages-immobile-mages-with-poll . 
Other ideas I've had are a added bonus to levels of the main wave clearing mechanics like lets say brand w would have a +5% bonus damage to minions at rank 1 +10% at rank 2 ect to +25% at rank 5 or even just giving the +25% at rank 5 only at rank 5 not scaling it up same with lux's e ori's w ect.
Another idea is giving them +5 movement speed at level 11 and +10 movement speed at level 16 to scale with ludens specifically to help with their lack of movement spells late game.

replies.body: If I had to guess, I'd say that recent buffs to Rylai's and Movement Speed changes to Luden's Echo may be enough to prop up one or two of the more immobile mages into competitive-level play, but I don't think it's likely that the meta shifts to immobile control mages mid, since a lot of other mages also get good benefit from the same changes.

so your saying its completely meta based, so may I ask what meta would it work it? ive been watching lcs since mid saeason 4~ and the only control mages ive rlly seen played a lot is 
1. viktor and that's because he has a move speed buff and slow that can be a stun with massive burst, 
2. ori amazing kit, and 
3. azirs op range with an escape.
4. xereth when his numbers were too high.
 through the different metas ive yet to see any of these mages and I think we have been through all other metas in that time
1. tank and fighter/carry metas in top and jngl and
2. both supportive/carry adcs and 
3. peeling/engage supports. and
 in mid its been 
1. assassins zed/talon(in worlds be4 silence nerf)/ahri
2. and a few control mages like ori/vik/azir/xer but for poke long range damage the teams rate 
3. immobile poke champs like varus and jayce 
over mages why is this? and what can be done to fix this?


sry if this isn't organized well or spelled well bit tired xD

Why is it that late game Viktor has more damage, more mobility, more versatility, and not much less control or zone power than Anivia? Why are Varus and Kog the go-to mid lane poke casters instead of Xerath? What exactly is Malz supposed to actually do that others can't also easily accomplish?

Addressing overlaps in power is the first key to "solving" the immobile mage problem, I think.

>ne or two of the more immobile mages into competitive-level play, but I don't think it's likely that the meta shifts to immobile control mages mid, since a lot of other mages also get good benefit from the same changes.

I'd say what immobile champs (not even just mages) need to be viable by in large is nerfs to mobility. To me the best way to do this would be to put a 'cripple' effect on a high end support item, essentially making mobility 'fall off' if the game goes long enough.
